intro: Goldbachia, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silvery down. Goldbachia thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
